subject: Personal Finance
title: The Goldsmith's Receipts
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Goldsmith's Receipts.

hook.text: London goldsmiths stored your gold and gave you a receipt. The receipt became the money.

buildup.text: In the 1600s, people started trading receipts instead of withdrawing gold. It was easier.

discovery.text: Goldsmiths realized most gold was never claimed. They could lend receipts for gold they didn't have.

twist.text: This was the accidental invention of fractional reserve banking â€” by jewelry makers.

climax.text: Modern banking, paper money, and credit all trace back to a goldsmith's clever shortcut.

quiz.question: How did goldsmith receipts lead to modern banking?
options: Goldsmiths lent out more receipts than gold they held
